pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Papers documenting Faulk's career as a folklorist, entertainer, author and target of the blacklist during the McCarthy years. The collection includes extensive files relating to Faulk's blacklisting experience and his legal case that interrupted his burgeoning career in radio and television broadcasting.
